name: Champaca x Duckbill Hook Book Festival: Get Hooked to Reading!
description: Join us for a weekend of storytelling, creativity, and hands-on fun at the Champaca x Duckbill Hook Book Festival! This festival is designed to inspire young readers and creators to dive into the world of books like never before. In a world where children’s books often feel cut from the same cloth,  Hook Books  stand out as a vibrant blend of imagination, humour, and heart. Crafted as a bridge between picture books and early chapter books, this series delivers stories that spark joy and wonder, while remaining rooted in age-appropriate learning. Published by Penguin India, the  Hook Books  series features stories by some of the country’s most beloved children's authors and illustrators. These books are designed to spark independent reading in early readers — with short, funny, and engaging stories, filled with delightful characters and vibrant illustrations. At Champaca, we’re thrilled to host  Getting Hooked to Reading , a festival of events celebrating these books through interactive sessions, storytelling, and creativity. Spanning across two weekend mornings, the Hook Book Festival is packed with joyful and engaging experiences for children. From story-building workshops and book cover design to interactive storytelling sessions, origami, and comic-making, there’s something for every kind of young reader and creator. These sessions are not just about books, they’re about building a love for reading, sparking imagination, and making stories come alive in the most hands-on, delightful ways. Here are the details of the festival: Day 1: May 24th, Saturday NARRATIVES IN ACTION: Story building workshop Time:  10:30 AM to 12 Noon Date:   24th May, Saturday Age Group:   10-12 Years Location:   Champaca Bookstore, Indiranagar About the Workshop:  Through an engaging blend of words, art, and puppetry, participants will explore how a single idea can branch into a multitude of narratives. Inspired by Adithi Rao’s book  Boy, Bear , the session will encourage young storytellers to experiment with different forms of creative expression and discover the magic of story-making.  Since there is limited seating, we recommend you confirm your spot  here . THE SWEET SHOP WARS: A Storytelling and Activity Session Time:   12 Noon to   12:30 PM Date:  24th May, Saturday Age Group:  5+ Years Location:  Champaca Bookstore, Indiranagar About the Workshop:  Join author Chatura Rao as she brings to life the tale of Firoza, a young girl determined to save her Grandpa’s beloved sweet shop after a flashy new competitor takes away all his customers. Through this delightful session based on the book  The Sweet Shop Wars , children will not only enjoy an engaging storytelling experience but also take part in a fun activity that sparks their imagination.  Since there is limited seating, we recommend you confirm your spot  here . GOT YOU COVERED: A book cover design workshop Time:   12:30 PM to 1:30 PM Date:  24th May, Saturday Age Group:  10+ Years Location:  Champaca Bookstore, Indiranagar About the Workshop:  Designed for children aged 10 and above, this session offers a unique behind-the-scenes look at what goes into creating a book cover—from initial concepts to final design. Participants will get an insider’s view of the creative process, learning how visuals, layout, and ideas come together to form the first impression of a book.  Since there is limited seating, we recommend you confirm your spot  here . Day 2: May 25th, Sunday WET PAINT: Storytelling and Activity Time:  11:00 AM to 11:45 AM Date:  25th May, Sunday Age Group:  5+ Years Location:  Champaca Bookstore, Indiranagar About the Workshop:  A super-fun and lively storytelling session based on the book Wet Paint! This interactive session promises to keep young listeners engaged with animated narration and plenty of opportunities to participate. Following the story, children will get to enjoy a creative, hands-on activity that brings the tale to life. Since there is limited seating, we recommend you confirm your spot  here . FLIP, FOLD, FLIP: Storytelling and Origami Activity Time:  11:45 AM to 12:30 PM Date:  25th May, Sunday Age Group:  5+ Years Location:  Champaca Bookstore, Indiranagar About the Workshop:  A storytelling and origami activity based on the book Gawa's Bag of Good Regards by Anushka Ravishankar. In this engaging workshop, children will discover the surprises hidden inside Gawa’s bag through an interactive narration, followed by a fun and creative origami folding session led by Canato himself.  Since there is limited seating, we recommend you confirm your spot  here . I WON’T WASH MY HAIR: Storytelling Time:  12:00 AM to 1:00 PM Date:  25th May, Sunday Age Group:  5+ Years Location:  Champaca Bookstore, Indiranagar About the Workshop:  Meet a girl who’s determined never to wash her hair, a dog named Riksha, and even some chilli from Chile in this fun, imaginative tale brought to life through Aparna Kapur’s narration. With its cast of colourful characters and playful premise, this session promises laughter, surprises, and a whole lot of charm. Since there is limited seating, we recommend you confirm your   spot  here .

name: Book discussion on FOR NO REASON AT ALL with Ramjee Chandran and Shinie Anthony
description: Join us at Champaca Bookstore in Vasanth Nagar for a conversation on  FOR NO REASON AT ALL , the latest book by  Ramjee Chandran , in conversation with writer and editor Shinie Anthony. An evening of storytelling and behind-the-scenes anecdotes about the making of a book that blends satire, suspense, and political drama. Event Details: Date:   Saturday, 24 May 2025 Time:   5:30 PM Venue:   Champaca Bookstore, Vasanth Nagar Since there is limited seating, we recommend you  book your spot soon . About the book: Set in New Delhi in the 1980s,  FOR NO REASON AT ALL  is based on true events. When a young Prime Minister is faced with a decision that could shape the future of Indian innovation, a storm brews around the local production of silicon metal. As corporate lobbying, foreign interference, and government ambition collide, a web of espionage, deception, and unexpected humour emerges. At the centre of it all is Solly Nilla, a sharp and adroit lobbyist, navigating diplomatic pressure, political power plays, and the chaos of a fast-changing world. With its blend of suspense and sharp social commentary, the novel offers both a thrilling plot and a wry reflection on bureaucracy, ambition, and absurdity. About the speakers: Ramjee Chandran  is a journalist, author, and media entrepreneur. He is the host of The Literary City podcast - featuring conversations with acclaimed writers, and The History of Bangalore podcast. A long-time magazine publisher and writer, he brings decades of experience to his fiction. He is currently working on his next book, The History of Bangalore, a meticulously researched narrative tracing the region’s history from prehistoric times to the present. He also plays jazz guitar at the professional level. Shinie Anthony  is the author of several novels and short story collections and is the curator of the Bangalore Literature Festival. Her work is known for its insight, dark humour, and emotional honesty, and she brings her signature wit and empathy to every literary conversation.

name: Soft-Launching A Fully Cooked Issue #3
description: Cooking is more than just an art; it’s a journey that connects us to our history, our communities, and our identities. It reflects the way we navigate life, from the food we prepare to the stories we share around the table. At Champaca, we are excited to invite you for the first exclusive preview of  dhoop’s third issue  through the lens of cooking -  a subject that opens up rich conversations about culture, identity, and the world we live in. We’re thrilled to invite you to the soft launch of  Dhoop Issue #3 ! Be the first to get your hands on a copy before it’s officially released. Join us for an evening where we not only delve into the importance of food but also celebrate the conversations it sparks. From a specially crafted menu inspired by the themes of the issue to insightful discussions, this event promises to be a rich, multi-sensory experience. Come for an exclusive sneak peek, stay for the conversation, and leave with a new perspective on cooking and its role in shaping our lives.
